item.title: Beogram 4000: A Fun Evening with a Prematurely Activating Solenoid
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 restoration is progressing well. Rebuilding the deck led to a successful initial power-up where the carriage moved to the correct position, but the arm wouldn’t lower. A visual inspection showed a disconnected thin grey wire from the SK3054 NPN power transistor (0TR4). Tracing the wiring and consulting the schematic revealed that the grey wire connected to the transistor’s emitter, responsible for bypassing a current-limiting resistor (7R1) during the arm’s initial descent...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Hood Restoration - Exchange of Trim, Fixing Cracked Hinges, Spray Painting Corroded Metal Parts and Polishing
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 I’m currently working on had a damaged dust cover. It was scratched, the metal hinges were corroded, the plexiglass around the hinges was cracked, and it had the typical early-model plastic trim that imitated aluminum. To start, I removed the plastic trim. It was attached with contact cement, so I warmed the dust cover in the oven at approximately 80 degrees Celsius (wrapped in aluminum foil to prevent hot spots) to soften the adhesive...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Exchanging the Plinth Panels
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 being restored arrived with a damaged plinth corner. As replacements are scarce, panels from a 4002 or 4004 model are often substituted, necessitating a swap of the metal fixtures due to variations in keypad design. The restoration begins by detaching the plinth from the metal casing. item.title: Beogram 4000: A New Arrival From Michigan - A First Look
item.description:
A Beogram 4000 turntable arrived from Michigan for restoration, carefully packaged according to instructions. The aluminum surfaces are in good condition, with one minor dent on the platter’s surrounding plate. The platter itself, keypads, and small aluminum plate are also in good shape. However, one corner of the plinth is damaged. Fortunately, replacement plinth panels were included, which will be installed. The hood has noticeable scratches, primarily on the surface, and should polish well...
